### 1. Generate API with Embed Scope
If you don't see this as an option, reach out to Retool Support or your Sales Engineer to enable the required license features

### 2. Create REST API Resource called Embed URL Generator
Replace ``<insert-your-domain>`` with your Retool domain, and ``<insert-token-from-step-1>`` with token from prior step
### 4. Get Uuid of App you want to embed, and ID of Groups you want user to join
#### GroupID:
#### App Uuid:
### 3. Update App to use your new resource
### 5. Plug in inputs into the form and test out embedding!

### 1. Generate API with Embed Scope
If you don't see this as an option, reach out to Retool Support or your Sales Engineer to enable the required license features. Save the generated token for the next step.

### 2. Create REST API Resource called Embed URL Generator
Replace ``<insert-your-domain>`` with your Retool domain, and ``<insert-token-from-step-1>`` with token from prior step

### 3. Update This App to Use New Resource
The `postEmbedURL` query needs to be updated to use your new `Embed URL Generator` resource

### 4. Get Embed App Uuid
This will be used later in the testing step. You can retrieve the Uuid from the URL of the app you'd like to embed by copying from the App URL like in the screenshot below. 
If you don't see the Uuid, reach out to Retool Support or your Sales Engineer to enable the feature flag

### 5. Get Group IDs for User Permissions
This will be used later in the testing step. You can retrieve the ID of the group from the URL like in the screenshot below. If you don't have a specific group set up, you can use one of the default groups (ID: 1 for example)

### 6. Test It Out!
You now have everything you need to test out embedding! To default to this page when the app loads in the future, make sure the `Set up complete?` toggle in the top right corner is switched on. 
*Note: You can use any App Uuid or Group IDs from your Retool instance without repeating steps 1-3*

template.label: Set up complete?
template.value: {{localStorage.values.embed_app_setup_complete}}
template.tooltipText: Use this toggle to jump to the Test it Out step. This will make that step the default when you load the app.

template.label: groupIds
template.tooltipText:
[Required] These are the groupIDs you can pass through for permissions to navigate to other applications from the embedded Iframe. Update this component with the Group IDs you want to pass through. The Group ID can be retrieved from the URL of your groups when accessing it directly in Retool. See the ``<groupId>`` in sample link below

https://``<retool_domain>``/settings/
permissions/group/``<groupId>``

### Retool Authenticated Embed URL Test Application
Use this application to run sample API calls, pass in custom metadata and preview the embedded app! 

**Go through the steps below to configure this app when using for the first time. 
If already configured, you can use the `Set up complete?` toggle on the right to jump to testing.**
:root { {{switch2.value ? '--retool-canvas-max-width: 100000px' : ''}} }
#### API Inputs - Body

template.label: landingPageUuid
template.tooltipText:
[Required] The page that will load in the embedded Iframe. It can be retrieved from the URL of your application when accessing it directly in Retool. See the ``<Uuid>`` in the sample link below

https://``<retool_domain>``/apps/``<Uuid>``

template.value: true

template.label: externalIdentifier
template.tooltipText: [Required] Mandatory field for unique identifier for external user. This can be any string. This can then be used for you to track usage as well as in the current_user object.

template.value: {{JSON.parse(postEmbedURL.body)}}

template.label: Preview in Iframe?
template.value: true
template.tooltipText: Leaving this toggle enabled will show the app in an Iframe below. Disabling the toggle will show a clickable link instead

template.tooltipText: [Optional] Duration in minutes of the embed session token. An optional field. If not included, default will be 600 minutes.
